author: Adam
message: I would have thought the most natural thing to do in this situation is simply come out of fullscreen mode, it's jarring enough that the user will certainly notice, look at the interface, see the disabled next button. It also gives them all the controls to plan their next action.

replies.author: J Janz
replies.message:
Or an in between workflow that we're already used to: Calligra Stage's
or LibreOffice Impress's black screen with just "End of Presentation.
Click to leave" (or something like it, as I'm translating from
Portuguese in my head). Seems to be the expected workflow for a fullscreen "slideshow" by now.

replies.author: J Janz
replies.message: That is, obviously not saying "End of Presentation" or "click" but maybe "Last document. Leaving fullscreen [mode]" or alike.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: I used fullscreen as an example: this notification is also useful when not running in fullscreen because even if the previous/next buttons are visible you are not focused on them when going through images.

author: Matthijs
message: I actually liked that feature, I think it's more annoying you won't be able to do anything with the right arrow.

replies.author: TheBlackCat13
replies.message: Same here. I hope it will be kept as an option. I do think having the clearer notification about the end of the list is good, though.,

author: Sebastian
message: What I would much prefer is jumping to the first image of the next folder.

replies.author: Heller
replies.message: yep, something like a recursive browsing of folders (ACDC has this). But this is another story. And I like the new behavior implemented by Aurelien :)

author: Richard
message:
Would be nice to have an overlay, where you actually can choose between different actions. I have seen this in an online image gallery.
Here I created a mockup:
http://wstaw.org/m/2014/01/...

The arrows are the shortcut for the action, but ofc it should also be possible to use the mouse. The background image is the last image.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: That is quite smart, need to think about it some more.

author: Happy Heyoka
message:
Perhaps something like the "loop" button in most music players these days; loop mode goes last -> first, non-loop mode just stops at the last image. Dropping out of fullscreen mode would upset some people doing presentations..

Personally the most annoying Gwenview behavior is the presentation/sort order for a directory. For bonus points, use the sort order set for that directory in Dolphin... Yeah, I know, post a feature request... :)
